name: Grilled Nacho Cashew Millet Cheese Sandwich with Roasted Sweet Potato, Pea Pesto. Vegan Recipe
description: Grilled Nacho Cashew Millet Cheese Sandwich with Roasted Sweet Potato, Pea Pesto. Creamy nacho cheese made with cashews and cooked millet. Makes 2
recipeIngredient: 1 clove of garlic or a generous pinch of garlic powder
1 Tablespoon extra virgin olive oil or coconut oil
1/4 cup Cooked Millet (or use cooked quinoa or a Tbsp cashew flour)
1 Tablespoon chopped red pepper or canned pimientos
a generous pinch of black salt (kala namak)
a generous pinch of garlic powder (cayenne powder and mustard powder)
Other: Slices of bread: I used Rye Almond Loaf Slices.
add Pickled Jalapeno (pickled onions, meat substitutes, fresh herbs, mashed Avocado.)

recipeInstructions.text: Pea Pesto: Blend all the ingredients. Use a little water if needed to get a spreadable consistency. Adjust salt and spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Pea Pesto: Blend all the ingredients. Use a little water if needed to get a spreadable consistency. Adjust salt and spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Roasted Sweet Potato: Brush the Sweet Potato slices on both sides. Place on parchment lined sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Roasted Sweet Potato: Brush the Sweet Potato slices on both sides. Place on parchment lined sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle salt and dried herbs of choice and bake at 415 degrees F / 210ºc for 18-20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle salt and dried herbs of choice and bake at 415 degrees F / 210ºc for 18-20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cashew Millet Cheese: Blend all the ingredients except millet. Taste and adjust salt and spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Cashew Millet Cheese: Blend all the ingredients except millet. Taste and adjust salt and spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Add millet and blend again to somewhat smooth state. Some unblended millet is fine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add millet and blend again to somewhat smooth state. Some unblended millet is fine.

recipeInstructions.text: If you are not planning to grill the sandwich at high heat, you can omit the tapioca starch. The starch helps the cheese sauce thicken and get stringy when hot. The cheese then sets as it cools and holds the sandwich together. * You can also use cooked quinoa or 2 tbsp more ground cashew.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are not planning to grill the sandwich at high heat, you can omit the tapioca starch. The starch helps the cheese sauce thicken and get stringy when hot. The cheese then sets as it cools and holds the sandwich together. * You can also use cooked quinoa or 2 tbsp more ground cashew.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Pea pesto. Prep the cheese ingredients and blend.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Pea pesto. Prep the cheese ingredients and blend.

recipeInstructions.text: Layer a bread slice with pesto, roasted sweet potato and red onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Layer a bread slice with pesto, roasted sweet potato and red onions.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle salt and pepper. Layer the cheese sauce generously on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle salt and pepper. Layer the cheese sauce generously on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with another bread slice and grill.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with another bread slice and grill.

recipeInstructions.text: You can add cheese sauce layers to both slices, add some jalapenos, any veggies(raw or roasted of choice and grill for a plain grilled nacho cheese sandwich.
recipeInstructions.name: You can add cheese sauce layers to both slices, add some jalapenos, any veggies(raw or roasted of choice and grill for a plain grilled nacho cheese sandwich.
